titles.en: Chapter 63 – The guardianship is for the one who emancipates

titles.ar: باب مَنْ مَاتَ وَ لَيْسَ لَهُ وَارِثٌ
titles.en: Chapter 61 – One dies and there is no inheritor for him

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/255)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ دَاوُدَ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَاتَ رَجُلٌ عَلَى عَهْدِ أَمِيرِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ وَارِثٌ فَدَفَعَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) مِيرَاثَهُ إِلَى هَمْشَهْرِيجِهِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from dawood, from the one who mentioned it,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘A man died in the era of Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup>, not having an inheritor for him, so Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> handed over his inheritance to his fellow city folk’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Dawud from those whom he has mentioned who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that in the time of ’Amir al-Mu’minin a man died and had no heirs. ’Amir al-Mu’minin gave his legacy to his Hamshahrijah (his fellow countryman). 5 ”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (23/256)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ خَلَّادٍ السِّنْدِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كَانَ عَلِيٌّ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَمُوتُ وَ يَتْرُكُ مَالًا وَ لَيْسَ لَهُ أَحَدٌ أَعْطِ الْمِيرَاثَ هَمْشَارِيجَهُ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Khallad Al Sindy,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Ali<sup>asws</sup> was saying regarding the man who died and left wealth, and there was no one for him: ‘Give the inheritance to his city folk’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Khallad al-Sindiy who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that ’Amir al-Mu’minin would say, ‘If a man dies without leaving behind any heirs then give his legacy to Hamshahrijah (his fellow countryman)
